intro: Tricalysia boiviniana, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite leaflets and produces small, winged seeds dispersed by wind. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warm climates. Tricalysia boiviniana is also valued for its ability to attract birds and insects due to its nectar-rich flowers.
